discourse_list.title: ERC-712, proposed by 0x devs, adopted in 0x Protocol v2

content.content: Hate it when you’re about to sign a message, but you’re unable to read the message you’re signing? So do we! That’s why 0x’s very own Leonid Logvinov and Remco Bloemen wrote EIP-712, a standard for hashing structured data, and why we’re adding support for it in V2.     0x Blog – 15 May 18    Introducing 0x Protocol V2 – 0x Blog The protocol for trading everything Reading time: 8 min read
content.GPT-summary: The post introduces the 0x Protocol V2 and explains the addition of EIP-712, a standard for hashing structured data, to the protocol. The post also mentions the authors of the proposal and their motivation behind it. Additionally, the post advertises the protocol and extends an invitation to use it.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal
